summary: The Mobility Means Freedom Tax Credit Act proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to establish a refundable tax credit for expenses related to mobility devices. This includes wheelchairs, scooters, walkers, and related equipment. The credit is equal to 50 percent of the cost of the device, with a limit of three devices per taxpayer per year. The bill also includes conforming amendments to ensure the credit interacts appropriately with other tax provisions and specifies an effective date post-enactment.
